docs.lead_paragraph: Most Republicans had a coherent economic message in midterm elections. Democrats were trounced because they lacked one.

headline.main: For Democrats, Finding a Message That Works
headline.print_headline: For Democrats, Finding a Message That Works

byline.original: By ALBERT R. HUNT | BLOOMBERG VIEW

docs.lead_paragraph: When Prime Minister Shinzo Abe responded to Japan's surprise recession by delaying a sales-tax increase, it was a cause for worry, not celebration, for many young Japanese. This generation, barely aware of their country's economic heyday, frets that putting off tough decisions now could make the future even worse.

headline.main: Japan's Young Fret as Unexpected Recession Hits
headline.print_headline: Japan's Young Fret as Unexpected Recession Hits

headline.main: Morning Agenda: Challenges for the Fed

docs.abstract: Last week was a rough one for the Federal Reserve. | Paul J. Taubman continues to poach talent from Morgan Stanley, his former employer. | Mathew Martoma has started his nine-year prison term for insider trading.
docs.snippet: Last week was a rough one for the Federal Reserve. | Paul J. Taubman continues to poach talent from Morgan Stanley, his former employer. | Mathew Martoma has started his nine-year prison term for insider trading.

docs.lead_paragraph: Oncologists say they are being forced to sell or close their practices because insurers have reduced payments to them and because drugs are so expensive.

headline.main: Private Oncologists Being Forced Out, Leaving Patients to Face Higher Bills
headline.print_headline: Private Oncologists Being Forced Out, Leaving Patients to Face Higher Bills

docs.abstract: Many private oncologists cannot afford to keep their practices and are joining medical centers or leaving medicine altogether, facing reduced insurance payments and rising drug costs; this trend is also fueling higher out-of-pocket costs for patients, as treatment costs, co-payments and bills to insurers are much higher at medical centers and hospitals.
docs.snippet: Oncologists say they are being forced to sell or close their practices because insurers have reduced payments to them and because drugs are so expensive.

docs.lead_paragraph: David Plotz charted a course for a long quest to find new career after leaving Slate, but quickly arrived at the travel website Atlas Obscura.

headline.main: Slate’s Former Top Editor Takes Helm at Travel Site
headline.print_headline: Slate’s Former Top Editor Takes Helm at Travel Site

docs.abstract: David Plotz, former editor in chief of online magazine Slate, is now the chief executive of little-known travel website Atlas Obscura.
docs.snippet: David Plotz charted a course for a long quest to find new career after leaving Slate, but quickly arrived at the travel website Atlas Obscura.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Affordable Care Act faces grave danger because legislative repair work that was once routine has grown impossible.

headline.main: In Partisan Washington, Health Law Faces Grave Legal Technicalities
headline.print_headline: In Cooperation’s Absence, a Phrase Yields a Supreme Court Case

docs.abstract: Political Memo; swift passage of 1997 Welfare Reform Technical Corrections Act underscores deteriorating conditions in current national politics, particularly when compared with debate surrounding Affordable Care Act; health care reform law faces grave danger before Supreme Court because same legislative repair work that was used to iron out welfare reform is impossible due, in part, to fundamentally different partisan backdrops and Republican Party's right-ward shift.
docs.snippet: The Affordable Care Act faces grave danger because legislative repair work that was once routine has grown impossible.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: An expanded version of “The Business of Being Born,” a documentary by the actress Ricki Lake that some experts say plays down the risks of delivering babies at home, will debut on Netflix.

headline.main: Home-Birth Film by Ricki Lake Prepares for Redelivery, Worldwide
headline.print_headline: Home-Birth Film Prepares for Redelivery, Worldwide

docs.abstract: Updated and expanded version of 2008 Ricki Lake documentary The Business of Being Born will be re-released in January 2015, becoming available globally for the first time; documentary is still criticized by some members of the American medical system who argue that Lake's enthusiasm for at-home births does not show how dangerous process can be.
docs.snippet: An expanded version of “The Business of Being Born,” a documentary by the actress Ricki Lake that some experts say plays down the risks of delivering babies at home, will debut on Netflix.
